cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 171, Number 187 (Friday, November 7, 2025)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BARR:H.R. 5929.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact thIs legislation underArticle I, Section 8 of the Constitution, including itsauthority to provide for the common defense, to regulatecommerce with foreign nations, and to make all laws necessaryand proper for carrying these powers into execution (Art. I,Sec. 8, Clauses 1, 3, and 18).[Page H4585]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

bill.title: Critical Minerals Supply Chain Resiliency Act

item.title: Critical Minerals Supply Chain Resiliency Act
Critical Minerals Supply Chain Resiliency Act
To adjust the treatment of certain actions under Presidential Determination 2022-11 for Federal permitting improvement, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
